intro: Bocagea corymbosa, commonly known as the Florida beauty or Florida bocagea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing evergreen shrub that typically reaches heights of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy green surface and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Bocagea corymbosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to stabilize soil in riparian areas.
